Unicode CLDR DataÂ¶

The Unicode.org CLDR data used to define the locale specific information such as the date and time formats also includes localized names for languages, scripts and territories. This localized information is included in the ZanyBlue Text library via the ZanyBlue.Text.CLDR package and can be used to translate abbreviations, e.g, en to localized named, e.g., the function call,

Language_Name ("en")

returns English in an English locale and anglais in a French locale. There localized names for scripts and territories are available via the functions Script_Name and Territory_Name functions.

All functions take an optional Unknown parameter giving the result returned for unknown names (defaulting to the empty string) and a final locale parameter.
